title: Problem-Solving Flexibility Enhancement Program Through STEM-Based 2D Geometry Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geometric shapes understanding (types of quadrilaterals, area calculations) and simple experimental design experience
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education utilizing smartphone-based VR simulation tools

learning_goals: Learners can perform optimal parachute design simulations by deforming 2D shapes according to various conditions (area, suspension line length).
Learners can propose at least three alternative approaches (modifying size, shape, or composition) for solving the same problem.
Learners can compare and analyze experimental results to select the most efficient solution strategy and explain the rationale.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
